posts.postText:
So gash asked me to make a guide to help players build maps for puzzle... So I did... took me like, 3 hours, maybe 4.
While I was at it, I threw in some details in the guide to help those who never really used source sdk hammer before/that much.
Actually, I went a bit overboard with my screenshots, considering my resolution, and the amount of them I took... the wordpad file is around 400mb (Thank you zip files, turning 400mb into 17mb to dl) but either way, it may take a lil bit to open the file itself.
I also included the map I made while working on the guide, for those who perfer a hands on appraoch.

All I really did was cover the basics... if people can somehow understand what I was teaching in this, not only would I be shocked, but I could start turning out more tutorials of this fashion. Might even start some basic video recordings if I get this thing working right.
Decided to add a poll for after reading through it/dont wanna touch it

Details of the download;
1 rtf(rich text file, aka wordpad or the likes required), size 400mb~, contains a slew of images alongside some text explaining the basics of mapping in addition to puzzle mapping, in addition to some statiscal numbers of the length of jumps of the average puzzler.
1 vmf, 84kb, the map for use in hammer after the results of the guide (with modified textures so other players can see them)
http://www.mediafire.com/?t2nvfbmv6g76tbr

Also, you may want to dl the gamemode for single player testing;
http://www.garrysmod.org/downloads/?a=view&id=52065
